intro: Lucilia pusilla, commonly known as the lesser green bottle fly, is a small species of fly belonging to the family Calliphoridae. It is characterized by its greenish body and metallic sheen, which helps it blend with foliage. The plant-related aspects of Lucilia pusilla are not directly relevant, as it is an insect rather than a plant. However, its larvae are often found on decaying organic matter, including plants, contributing to decomposition processes. This species plays a role in nutrient cycling in ecosystems where plant matter is abundant.
